thread.title: Full 9th Circuit may review immigration ban ruling
thread.title_full: Full 9th Circuit may review Trump immigration ban ruling | Washington Examiner

title: Full 9th Circuit may review immigration ban ruling
text:
The 9th Circuit Court of Appeals will vote next week on whether the full federal appeals court should vote on whether to lift a block on President Trump 's immigration .
A three-judge panel on Thursday unanimously ruled to keep the ban in place while the courts consider the merits of Washington state's case against the ban.
"We hold that the government has not shown a likelihood of success on the merits of its appeal, nor has it shown that failure to enter a stay would cause irreparable injury, and we therefore deny its emergency motion for a stay," the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals ruled .
However, an unnamed appeals court judge on Friday asked for a vote by the full court on the ruling. Now, both sides must file briefs by Thursday at 2 p.m. EST on whether they think a full review, called "en banc," is needed.
Subscribe today to get intelligence and analysis on defense and national security issues in your Inbox each weekday morning from veteran journalists Jamie McIntyre and Jacqueline Klimas.
  the Daily on Defense newsletter.   issue soon! Trump immediately ripped the court decision on Twitter Thursday night, saying, in part, 'WE'LL SEE YOU IN COURT."
On Friday, he said that he might sign a "brand new order" next week, while a senior White House official said that Trump did not plan to appeal the ruling to the Supreme Court .
